description: From Middle English authentik, from Old French autentique, from Latin authenticus, from Ancient Greek αὐθεντικός (authentikós, “principal, genuine”), from Ancient Greek αὐθέντης (authéntēs, “lord, master”).

adjectives.description: authentic (comparative more authentic, superlative most authentic)

entries.meaning: Of the same origin as claimed; genuine.
examples: The experts confirmed it was an authentic signature.

entries.meaning: Conforming to reality and therefore worthy of trust, reliance, or belief.
examples: an authentic writer; an authentic portrait; authentic information

entries.meaning: (music, of a Gregorian mode) Having the final as the lowest note of the mode.
